distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
Updated firefox packages that fix multiple security issues are now
available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 and 6.

The Red Hat Security Response Team has rated this update as having critical
security impact. Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base scores,
which give detailed severity ratings, are available for each vulnerability
from the CVE links in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mozilla Firefox is an open source web browser. XULRunner provides the XUL
Runtime environment for Mozilla Firefox.

A flaw was found in Sanitiser for OpenType (OTS), used by Firefox to help
prevent potential exploits in malformed OpenType fonts. A web page
containing malicious content could cause Firefox to crash or, under certain
conditions, possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user
running Firefox. (CVE-2011-3062)

A web page containing malicious content could cause Firefox to crash or,
potentially, execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running
Firefox. (CVE-2012-0467, CVE-2012-0468, CVE-2012-0469)

A web page containing a malicious Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) image file
could cause Firefox to crash or, potentially, execute arbitrary code with
the privileges of the user running Firefox. (CVE-2012-0470)

A flaw was found in the way Firefox used its embedded Cairo library to
render certain fonts. A web page containing malicious content could cause
Firefox to crash or, under certain conditions, possibly execute arbitrary
code with the privileges of the user running Firefox. (CVE-2012-0472)

A flaw was found in the way Firefox rendered certain images using WebGL. A
web page containing malicious content could cause Firefox to crash or,
under certain conditions, possibly execute arbitrary code with the
privileges of the user running Firefox. (CVE-2012-0478)

A cross-site scripting (XSS) flaw was found in the way Firefox handled
certain multibyte character sets. A web page containing malicious content
could cause Firefox to run JavaScript code with the permissions of a
different website. (CVE-2012-0471)

A flaw was found in the way Firefox rendered certain graphics using WebGL.
A web page containing malicious content could cause Firefox to crash.
(CVE-2012-0473)

A flaw in Firefox allowed the address bar to display a different website
than the one the user was visiting. An attacker could use this flaw to
conceal a malicious URL, possibly tricking a user into believing they are
viewing a trusted site, or allowing scripts to be loaded from the
attacker's site, possibly leading to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
(CVE-2012-0474)

A flaw was found in the way Firefox decoded the ISO-2022-KR and ISO-2022-CN
character sets. A web page containing malicious content could cause Firefox
to run JavaScript code with the permissions of a different website.
(CVE-2012-0477)

A flaw was found in the way Firefox handled RSS and Atom feeds. Invalid
RSS or Atom content loaded over HTTPS caused Firefox to display the
address of said content in the location bar, but not the content in the
main window. The previous content continued to be displayed. An attacker
could use this flaw to perform phishing attacks, or trick users into
thinking they are visiting the site reported by the location bar, when the
page is actually content controlled by an attacker. (CVE-2012-0479)

For technical details regarding these flaws, refer to the Mozilla security
advisories for Firefox 10.0.4 ESR. You can find a link to the Mozilla
advisories in the References section of this erratum.

Red Hat would like to thank the Mozilla project for reporting these issues.
Upstream acknowledges Mateusz Jurczyk of the Google Security Team as the
original reporter of CVE-2011-3062; Aki Helin from OUSPG as the original
reporter of CVE-2012-0469; Atte Kettunen from OUSPG as the original
reporter of CVE-2012-0470; wushi of team509 via iDefense as the original
reporter of CVE-2012-0472; Ms2ger as the original reporter of
CVE-2012-0478; Anne van Kesteren of Opera Software as the original reporter
of CVE-2012-0471; Matias Juntunen as the original reporter of
CVE-2012-0473; Jordi Chancel and Eddy Bordi, and Chris McGowen as the
original reporters of CVE-2012-0474; Masato Kinugawa as the original
reporter of CVE-2012-0477; and Jeroen van der Gun as the original reporter
of CVE-2012-0479.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: Off-by-one error in the OpenType Sanitizer in Google Chrome before 18.0.1025.142 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted OpenType file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Off-by-one error in OpenType Sanitizer (MFSA 2012-31)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
All Firefox users should upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain Firefox version 10.0.4 ESR, which corrects these issues. After
installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to
take effect.

Before applying this update, make sure all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to
use the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Off-by-one error in OpenType Sanitizer (MFSA 2012-31)

notes.text: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, and SeaMonkey before 2.9 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Miscellaneous memory safety hazards (rv:12.0/ rv:10.0.4) (MFSA 2012-20)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
All Firefox users should upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain Firefox version 10.0.4 ESR, which corrects these issues. After
installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to
take effect.

Before applying this update, make sure all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to
use the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Miscellaneous memory safety hazards (rv:12.0/ rv:10.0.4) (MFSA 2012-20)

notes.text: The browser engine in Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, and SeaMonkey before 2.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and memory corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors related to jsval.h and the js::array_shift function.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Miscellaneous memory safety hazards (rv:12.0/ rv:10.0.4) (MFSA 2012-20)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
All Firefox users should upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain Firefox version 10.0.4 ESR, which corrects these issues. After
installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to
take effect.

Before applying this update, make sure all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to

https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Miscellaneous memory safety hazards (rv:12.0/ rv:10.0.4) (MFSA 2012-20)

notes.text: Use-after-free vulnerability in the mozilla::dom::indexedDB::IDBKeyRange::cycleCollection::Trace function in Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, and SeaMonkey before 2.9 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectors related to crafted IndexedDB data.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: use-after-free in IDBKeyRange (MFSA 2012-22)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
All Firefox users should upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain Firefox version 10.0.4 ESR, which corrects these issues. After
installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to

notes.text: Heap-based buffer overflow in the nsSVGFEDiffuseLightingElement::LightPixel function in Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, and SeaMonkey before 2.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid gfxImageSurface free operation) or possibly execute arbitrary code by leveraging the use of "different number systems."
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Invalid frees causes heap corruption in gfxImageSurface  (MFSA 2012-23)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

All Firefox users should upgrade to these updated packages, which

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Invalid frees causes heap corruption in gfxImageSurface  (MFSA 2012-23)

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, and SeaMonkey before 2.9 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a multibyte character set.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Potential XSS via multibyte content processing errors (MFSA 2012-24)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
All Firefox users should upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain Firefox version 10.0.4 ESR, which corrects these issues. After
installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to

Before applying this update, make sure all previously-released errata

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to

https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Potential XSS via multibyte content processing errors (MFSA 2012-24)

notes.text: The cairo-dwrite implementation in Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, and SeaMonkey before 2.9, when certain Windows Vista and Windows 7 configurations are used, does not properly restrict font-rendering attempts, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Potential memory corruption during font rendering using cairo-dwrite (MFSA 2012-25)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
All Firefox users should upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain Firefox version 10.0.4 ESR, which corrects these issues. After
installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to
take effect.

Before applying this update, make sure all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to
use the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Potential memory corruption during font rendering using cairo-dwrite (MFSA 2012-25)

notes.text: The WebGLBuffer::FindMaxUshortElement function in Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, and SeaMonkey before 2.9 calls the FindMaxElementInSubArray function with incorrect template arguments, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from video memory via a crafted WebGL.drawElements call.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: WebGL.drawElements may read illegal video memory due to FindMaxUshortElement error (MFSA 2012-26)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
All Firefox users should upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain Firefox version 10.0.4 ESR, which corrects these issues. After
installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to
take effect.

Before applying this update, make sure all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to
use the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: WebGL.drawElements may read illegal video memory due to FindMaxUshortElement error (MFSA 2012-26)

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the docshell implementation in Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, and SeaMonkey before 2.9 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors related to short-circuited page loads, aka "Universal XSS (UXSS)."
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Page load short-circuit can lead to XSS (MFSA 2012-27)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Page load short-circuit can lead to XSS (MFSA 2012-27)

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, and SeaMonkey before 2.9 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) ISO-2022-KR or (2) ISO-2022-CN character set.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Potential XSS through ISO-2022-KR/ISO-2022-CN decoding issues (MFSA 2012-29)

https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Potential XSS through ISO-2022-KR/ISO-2022-CN decoding issues (MFSA 2012-29)

notes.text: The texImage2D implementation in the WebGL subsystem in Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, and SeaMonkey before 2.9 does not properly restrict JSVAL_TO_OBJECT casts, which might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted web page.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Crash with WebGL content using textImage2D (MFSA 2012-30)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
All Firefox users should upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain Firefox version 10.0.4 ESR, which corrects these issues. After
installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to
take effect.

Before applying this update, make sure all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to
use the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Crash with WebGL content using textImage2D (MFSA 2012-30)

notes.text: Mozilla Firefox 4.x through 11.0, Firefox ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, Thunderbird 5.0 through 11.0, Thunderbird ESR 10.x before 10.0.4, and SeaMonkey before 2.9 allow remote attackers to spoof the address bar via an https URL for invalid (1) RSS or (2) Atom XML content.
